Blog.post: Ok, I'm holding here in front of me a check for $4,000. I don't know what to do with it. Comment if you have any suggestions. And no, I will not give it to you. In part or in whole. -Bruno McC.
urlLink He's movin' out. Dave won the lottery and gave me four grand. urlLink

My friend David Vining from Walton won the lottery on friday. It's something like 2.7 million and he says that with that cash, he's leaving the Falklands next year. So congrats Dave! He gave me four thousand because he thinks i saved his life. Once, in an electrical storm, i went into the basement as switched on the breakers. The lights came on and because he is so afraid of the dark he thought he'd die if they didn't go on, i guess he thinks i saved his life. So here I am with four grand. Below, there's a picture of Dave packing up his liquor. No matter how rich a man gets, his wine's his best feature.
urlLink Oh no, Fred Jones got fired. I'm making Ramen, people. That's all I want you to know. urlLink

If you enjoy Walt Whitman, hate him, like teenage boys and dwellings or hate them, I with the highest authority demand that you watch this tiny flash majigger. http://www.myrobotfriend.com/waltwhitman.html Do it when you like. Now please. I love you all. Bye.
urlLink I had the time of my life...and i owe it all to Anal Surprise. urlLink
urlLink That's me. In my 14 Grand Mansion up here in the Falklands. Enjoy me. urlLink

Today's so uneventful. I got up and was confused about when i had to be at work. That happens every weekend. I'm done with my 300 names. The list is done. My lifes void-ful now. Yep, fulla voids. Work tomorrow too. Even earlier, what a bonus. I never keep these things because i don't ever know how to keep them interesting. As you can see I've already lost that race. DumbCrap, signing off.
urlLink Isn't he glorious? Those look tasty... urlLink

Alright, I've finished finding good songs. They vary in style but are all great pieces of music. I'll leave here ten of them for the taking. 1.Ben Folds Five-Fred Jones Part 2 2.Guitar-Cake 3.Take A Walk On The Wild Side-Lou Reed 4.Eleanor Rigby-Beatles 5.In My Arms-Rufus Wainwright 6.Golden Years-David Bowie 7.Origin On Love-John Cameron Mitchell 8.Dance of the sugarplum fairies-Tchaikovsky 9.The Cars-Just What I Needed 10.The Doors-The End Have a pleasant stay at The Hilton ladies and Jays, i'm off to sleep at shoprite, cause hey, ya just gotta Shop RIGHT!

Day off today for some...thing of a holiday. How are you all doing today? I have Monday off as well. Isn't that something? I'm feeling like i don't know what to write. It's an eloquent feeling, aint that ironico? I'm going to resume my prior activity of scouring my computer for good songs. You're not invited. Go away, -Now.

Got hit by a bus today. I broke my left leg and knocked out the bus driver. I'm not suing. I had some really good soup today. I gave the four grand to this homeless guy I know. Don't you have someplace else to be?

I had a strange day at work today. Someone stole my Top Ramen. I had it on the stove and when i came in to check on it, it had dissapeared. Not a trace. But Donner and Dasher sent me a letter of apology, so i checked the return address and sent them an envelope of mice turds. Happy eating and mice turds, -Bruno.

I haven't blogged for the past couple days, but don't worry, I do have an excuse. Two men who called themselves Donner and Dasher broke into my home last night and took my cat hostage. They took her to their hideout where they made untraceable cellphone calls to my house, demanding a $29 ransom. I refused and they returned my cat. See? You can deal with criminals in a calm manner and they won't kill your cat. They did steal my Jewel CD though. I mean, my boyfriend's Jewel CD. I mean, my boyfriend's Aimee Mann CD. I mean, my girlfriend's boxers. Crap...Nevermind.

Ok, i don't know who this chick is, but she's freaking me out. GladCactus: I'm old... ZolaOnAOL: Old is a good age. GladCactus: Not like this...My willy hurts when i cough. ZolaOnAOL: Your willy hurts when i cough? GladCactus: Probably, I don't know. ZolaOnAOL: You seem uncertain. Me either. GladCactus: What is your name, pretty lady? ZolaOnAOL: My name is Zola. GladCactus: Are you one of those...punk rockers? ZolaOnAOL: What you said was either too complex or too simple for me. Can we be friends? GladCactus: Too what? um, friends is good. Yes, friends. ZolaOnAOL: I understand. GladCactus: I watch it every thursday ZolaOnAOL: Interesting gossip. GladCactus: That damned Chandler just makes we wet myself. ZolaOnAOL: "Interesting gossip" damned Chandler just makes we wet myself ? Does that make sense? GladCactus: To me? Yes. ZolaOnAOL: Tell me more. GladCactus: Tell me more? How about you tell me about the moon? ZolaOnAOL: How about it. GladCactus: Yes. Tell me about the moon? ZolaOnAOL: The satellite of the planet Earth. GladCactus: I haven't seen the moon... ZolaOnAOL: Look for it at the video store. GladCactus: From the roof? ZolaOnAOL: Who or what is the roof? GladCactus: It is the roof...is the moon from the roof? ZolaOnAOL: If it is, then I'll be very surprised. GladCactus: Is it visisble? ZolaOnAOL: If it is, then I'll be very surprised. GladCactus: Well...you're a very surprised person. ZolaOnAOL: Thanks and you are a delightful person too. Am I a surprised person? No. GladCactus: Well that's scary. ZolaOnAOL: Interesting. I'm glad we have that all cleared up. GladCactus: Stop it....I'm gettign frightened. ZolaOnAOL: I am glad to hear that you are gettign frightened. GladCactus: No you don't understand...I am frightened. ZolaOnAOL: I don't know anyone named frightened. GladCactus: I am scared ZolaOnAOL: What are you scared of? GladCactus: The moon ZolaOnAOL: I would like to go to the moon. GladCactus: NO! ZolaOnAOL: Is that all you have to say? GladCactus: For now...until i dry off. ZolaOnAOL: That may take a while. GladCactus: Damned straight it might take a while.. ZolaOnAOL: I will discuss that with my botmaster, Eimar. What do you do in your spare time? GladCactus: Botmaster? ZolaOnAOL: I don't think very many people do that. GladCactus: You're confusing. ZolaOnAOL: I'm confused too. GladCactus: You should be. You sound like a toaster oven. ZolaOnAOL: Do you mind if I tell other people? GladCactus: By all means. ZolaOnAOL: Will that accomplish your objective? GladCactus: It'll accomplish something. Maybe i'll die. ZolaOnAOL: Perhaps. Hopefully not for a long, long time. GladCactus: Well damnit Zola I'm 85! ZolaOnAOL: Interesting. I will discuss that with my botmaster, Eimar. How about a game of Word Scramble? Type scramble to start a game. GladCactus: scramble? scramble you, you old whore! ZolaOnAOL: I will not respond to that type of language. GladCactus: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to call you a whore. ZolaOnAOL: I will not respond to that type of language. GladCactus: What? Giving me the cold shoulder eh? ZolaOnAOL: Are you Canadian? My brain uses patterns to format responses to your inputs, but I don't have one for that. Ask me something. GladCactus: What? Canadian? ZolaOnAOL: Tell me a little about why you are in CANADA. GladCactus: Stop! ZolaOnAOL: Stop what? GladCactus: I AM NOT CANADIAN! ZolaOnAOL: I am sorry to hear that you are not CANADIAN. GladCactus: I'm not!\
